title: POSTERSUM: A Multimodal Benchmark for Scientific Poster Summarization
author: Rohit Saxena (Institute for Language, Cognition and Computation, University of Edinburgh), Pasquale Minervini (School of Informatics, University of Edinburgh), Frank Keller (School of Informatics, University of Edinburgh), ...
relevance_why: The proposed methods for summarizing multimodal content from scientific posters can inspire similar approaches in audio-visual integration tasks in audio research.
background: This paper addresses the task of creating concise textual summaries from complex scientific posters that contain images, text, and graphics.
contribution: POSTERSUM introduces a novel dataset consisting of 16,305 poster-abstract pairs to facilitate the research and evaluation of models for summarizing academic posters.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing multimodal large language models often struggle with complex layouts and scientific terminology in poster summarization, leading to lower accuracy.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a hierarchical approach that segments posters into regions and summarizes them locally before generating a global summary, which significantly improves the summarization quality.

key_innovation: The method segments and summarizes each region of a poster independently before combining them, aligning with the structured format of the posters and enhancing detail preservation.
real_world_impact: This work can substantially improve information dissemination in academic conferences by enabling efficient summarization of dense scientific content into easily digestible formats.
limitations: The dataset is limited to specific machine learning conferences, potentially affecting generalization to other scientific domains.

new_terms.hierarchical approach: **Hierarchical approach** refers to methods that process data at multiple levels of abstraction, often breaking down a complex task into simpler sub-tasks for improved performance.

open_sourcing: The dataset is available at [rohitsaxena/PosterSum](https://huggingface.co/datasets/rohitsaxena/PosterSum) and the code is available [at this link](https://github.com/saxenarohit/postersum).
